learning_objectives.objective: Define the .well-known directory and its purpose according to RFC 5785.
Explain the role of .well-known directory enumeration in the information gathering phase of penetration testing, including its relation to OWASP WSTG-INFO-04.
Use tools like gobuster or feroxbuster to enumerate files in the .well-known directory on a target web server.
Interpret HTTP response codes (e.g., 200, 403, 404) from .well-known enumeration scans to identify exposed files and potential misconfigurations.
Assess the security risks of common .well-known files (e.g., security.txt, change-password) and debate the balance between thorough reconnaissance and ethical boundaries.
Design a custom wordlist and enumeration script for .well-known files, including mitigation strategies for findings in a pentest report.
